perturbation.original_text: 5.1  The Principal shall pay the Company a fee of $1.00 (one dollar), inclusive      of VAT, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 The Principal shall pay the Company a fee as mutually agreed upon by both parties, taking into consideration market conditions and prevailing industry rates, per one net tonne of Commodity shipped pursuant to this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a fixed fee, while the modified text introduces a variable fee dependent on market conditions. This contradicts any other section assuming a fixed fee and makes enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: 1.1  The Company, at the expense and on the instructions of the Principal, shall      arrange transportation for export in batches to the far abroad of crude oil      ("Commodity") belonging to the Principal and shall provide such other      services in connection therewith as are provided in this Contract.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  The Company may, subject to its operational capacity and at the expense and on the instructions of the Principal, endeavor to arrange transportation for export in batches to the far abroad of crude oil      ("Commodity") belonging to the Principal and may provide such other      services in connection therewith as are provided in this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the Company 'shall' arrange transportation, creating an obligation. The changed text weakens this obligation to 'may endeavor,' introducing ambiguity about the Company's responsibility and creating a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text:
9.1  In accordance with items 9.3, 9.4, and 10.3, this Contract shall come into      force on the Effective Date, remain effective throughout the Initial Term,      and be prolonged, or further extended automatically for a period of 12



     months, each such extension commencing at the end of the last day of the      Initial Term or the relevant anniversary thereof, unless either Party      serves written notice of termination on the other Party at least 65 days      prior to the end of the Initial Term, or any subsequent extension.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.1  In accordance with items 9.3, 9.4, and 10.3, this Contract shall come into      force on the Effective Date, remain effective throughout the Initial Term,      and may be prolonged, or further extended automatically for a period of 12



     months, each such extension commencing at the end of the last day of the      Initial Term or the relevant anniversary thereof, unless both Parties mutually agree to serve written notice of termination on the other Party at least 65 days prior to the end of the Initial Term, or any subsequent extension.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies the auto renewal of the contract unless either party terminates the contract by giving notice. The changed text says auto renewal occurs only when both parties agree to give a termination notice. This introduces a conflict, as the original section implies any of the parties can terminate, but in changed section, only both the parties can terminate the contract with consensus.
